title: L'Anse aux Meadows
summary: L'Anse aux Meadows (/ˈlænsi ˈmɛdoʊz/) is an archaeological site first excavated in the 1960s of a Norse settlement dating to approximately 1,000 years ago (carbon dating estimates 990–1050 CE).[1][2][3] The site is located on the northernmost tip of the island of Newfoundland in the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador.
